729852f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Louis Street, Staten Island, NY
729852f-a.text:
Victory Boulevard, east side, south of Louis Street, showing the Catholic school of the Sisters of Notre Dgm~.
May 1925
P.L.Sperr

728940f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Louis Street, Staten Island, NY
728940f-a.text:
Hero Park (Staten lIsland): Shown is 'Sugar Loaf Rock,' a glacial boulder. The park is dedicated to the memory of those who died in the World War (1914-1918); a plaque to that effect
having been placed on the rock.
Juno 12, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the park. The park occupies a small
area on Victory Boulevard, at Louis Street.
June 12, 1937
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A winter scene in Hero Park.
April7, 1938
P. L. Sperr

728943f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Louis Street, Staten Island, NY
728943f-a.text:
Hero Park (Staten Island): Two winter scenes of the
amall park at the S. E. corner of Victory Boulevard and Louis Street. The park was dedicated in 1920 to the martyrs of the World War and a bronze tablet on Sugar loaf Rock (view 3) bears the names
of Staten Islanders who died in the war.
April 7, 1938
Views 1 and 2
P. L. Sperr
(3)
A view of Sugar Loaf Rock, one of the remaining boulders
of the Glacial Period.
June 23, 1937
P. L. Sperr

728941f-a.folder: Victory Boulevard & Louis Street, Staten Island, NY
728941f-a.text:
(1)
Hero Pgrk: A view westward toward Victory Boulevard, and the Jewish Community Center (center building). The park is located at the S.E. corner of Victory Boulevard and Louis Street.
April 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another winter scene.
April 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of the park in an easterly direction along the foot path
seen in views 1 and 2.
April 7, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.  NO REPRODUCTIONS.
